intro: Euphrasia bowdeniae, commonly known as the Bowden's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
